column4: I'd like to be able to do things like reinstall grub after a windows install, but I don't want to use the ubuntu live cd. What could I do?
you could use the gparted live cd if you have some hatred of the ubuntu live cd ... otherwise any partition utility that can set a part active will work
Scunizi isn't there a way to burn a bootable cd which has that interpreter and all the programs needed to install grub to the boot sector?
i am sure there is .. but the live cd will take you 5 mins to book
